name: Work in progress: zen archery cleric
author: elypzkou

posts.author: elypzkou
posts.content:
Good morning everyone, I am a new player to the neverwinter night scene but I am not completely new to dnd.
I played a lot of pathfinder: kingmaker in the past which was mildly different lol, but it gave me a rough idea of what to expect going into neverwinter nights.

I am playing on a server with a few odd settings: up to level 40 it's very low magic, with +5 items mostly dropping from bosses and some items being super rare. I had a friend help out with my first character (bard/rdd0) and eventually made it to level 40,  yet I still need to find one amulet of natural armor better than +3.

However after you hit level 40 and you start doing epic dungeons things ramp up pretty quickly, there's knockdown immunity helmets, permanent haste bracers, death immunity belts and stuff like that. 
The problem is that epic dungeons are super hard and my bard ends up as a buff dispenser most of the times, can't get too close or i die.

So with this in mind I decided to make something safer and my idea was a zen archery cleric.

This is just a theory build atm so there might be a few mistakes, before i fully commit to this new character i would like to ask a few questions.
What do you think of called shot ? I read in a different thread that it's nice to have it but I am not sure I want to give up thoughness for it.
On the same note, rapid shot vs called shot ? Can i take a called shot and attack again or is it a full round action ?

Anyways the idea is to make a cleric with high dc and high ac, with archery as a solid backup option if i run out of spells (dungeons are no-rest zones) or if i meet foes with too many saving throws.

If you have any questions or suggestions please let me know, hopefully i didn't get anything too wrong lol.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hello and welcome, elypzkou! Good to have you on board.

I'll confess from the start that I know very little about clerics, so I'll just concentrate on other stuff and let people who know more give divine advice.

First, I'd drop Toughness. An archer/caster shouldn't need a deep pool of hit points - they're trying to avoid getting hit by staying out of the action, right? I'm also not sure about Called Shot in this scenario - 1) with -4 to your AB (you'd have a total of 5 at level 3 with your current levelling, so subtracting 4 would give you a princely 1 - a 5% chance to even hit an enemy), you'd be taking it way too early. Blind Fight might be a better option. However, see below.

I'm assuming you'd be taking all your Tumble points at level 39 (your monk level), which is great for a +8 boost to AC (and the +14 monk Wisdom AC bonus), but that's a hell of a long time to wait. Oh, and what sort of armour do you see yourself wearing? Presumably, you'd be shedding it for robes when you do take monk, or you'd lose that juicy Wisdom AC.

Personally, I'd think about taking your cleric feats earlier pre-epic and dropping Fighter to take some Champion of Torm levels later on (CoT also allows you to take Great Wisdom as an epic bonus feat, as well as giving bonus feats every other level up CoT 10, so you could build both Called Shot and Blind Fight in, and a +1 to all saves every other level). I'd also consider taking a few more levels of monk (at least 2 more, for the monk speed and +2 saves vs mind spells, as well as deflect arrows at level 2). Yes, that would mean dropping cleric levels down a few notches, but it would give you a lot more scope (and make playability easier at lower levels). Maybe a Cleric 26/ CoT 10/ Monk 4? But I'm straying into what cleric brings, about which I'm no help.

Anyway, just my two-pennyworth.

Welcome again!

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hello and welcome elypzkou!

It sounds like you are looking for a powerful level 40+ optimised cleric zen archer. Stag has made some good comments already, and others may give input, so my input shall be to direct you to some level 40+ optimised cleric zen archer builds to see what you might want to add.

Probably the most famous level 40+ optimised cleric zen archer is the so called 'Demolition Man' by Maximillan Kane. It has been very extensively play tested.

My view is that in an environment without powerful ammunition or the ability to buff such ammunition (ie a non-WoG environment), it might lack damage.

So I personally have been working on a few zen archer builds adding divine damage or other cool stuff might be more optimal. 

I made a simple modification to the Demolition Man build to add divine damage, its called Divine Demolition Man. Not yet play tested so I've put it in the unfinished section but feel free to have a look and see if there are features that might improve your build

I also like Druids and having lots of spells plus turning into a dragon sounds cool when in close range, so I made a divine damage zen archer with Druid level 9 undispellable spells and Cleric level 8 spells, its less of a DC caster than more of a versatile type build. See Divine Damage Druid Dragon Shape Zen Archer post 5 of thread. Its more of a druid with cleric spells to buff zen archery stuff (or dragon shape). I'm in the process of play testing this so again its in the unfinished section.

Hope these three builds help you with your quest.

By the way, in case you weren't aware, I find Kamiryn's Character Build Calculator Excel Spreadsheet a useful tool for designing builds. 

Edit: Heh I've been ninja'ed by Web. Web's build is very nice, it gets +6 damage from WS/EWS which is a very elegant solution reducing investment in Divine Damage, that is something to consider too!

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I tend to rely on builds that do not have X number a day type things as much as possible - because, IMO, they tend to run out exactly when one wants (or needs) to use them, often leaving one stuck with a dirtnap or timesink!
Divine Might
Prereqs: turn undead, charisma 13+, strength 13+, power attack

Specifics: The character may spend one of his turn undead attempts to add his charisma bonus to all weapon damage for a number of rounds equal to the charisma bonus.
This is why I just do not like DM (and DS) - because you basically are needing 3 main stats here - Str, Wis, Cha.

That spreads things too thin IMO.

The Smooth Archer gets around this by investing in ONE stat!  One. 

This makes it superior for a number of reasons - 1, is that Wis as the main casting stat of Clerics means that one can have really good Spell DCs (Implosion hell!), and also, more of them.

Second, Wis is a main stat for Monks, as it gives them unreducible AC - meaning that one cannot loose it (iirc).

Three, with Zen Archery, it is used as the main AB stat!

Since The Smooth Archer has basically scavenged other stats to further pump Wis, this does mean that it really needs to focus on Archery (or Crossbow).  Of course, with the ability to cast Divine Power, that then becomes a fairly moot point later on.

I will say that this build does suffer at beginning levels due to the extremely low str - which will prevent one from armoring up if str items are not available - one may wish to redistribute a few points from Dex to Str to accomodate this (and avoid Halfling).

So now the good news!  A Crossbow is not affected by a low str!  That's right, unlike other missle weapons, a Crossbow is not affected by low Str here - so it makes for a really good weapon in this build!  It also has higher damage and a better crit range than a bow.

If i can get a party going with other new players this is definitely one build i want to try though.

@Stagmeister good point about  called shot, blind fight would work best here. I also found out that in order to keep dodge AC vs unseen enemies blind fight is required,  listen alone is not enough. So this feat slot would definitely go to blind fight.

This shouldn't be too hard with how frontloaded a human fighter is when it comes to feats. CoT is another option here but i could only take it later down the line and the first levels would be a bit harder. Good call about going at least 3 monk though, the class  spread between monk and fighter is one of the things that I am considering atm.

@Orion2019  the demolition man looks very strong in a pvp situation but i think it's a bit too specialized compared to what i'm trying to do. Stealth + DC is a tempting option when you want to nuke unsuspecting folks (wish monks didn't have to be lawful, so i could roleplay this as chaotic neutral lol) but i want to be strong with a bow for dungeons :S

If I decide to go with halfling the heavy crossbow might be a good alternative to the shortbow, i just don't know if i can carry it around with 6 base strength lol. How heavy are we talking about, exactly ?
